intro: Psychotria stipulacea var. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaved psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage. The plant typically features glossy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Due to its medicinal properties and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
